STI.P: List of reference standards and specifications for the validation of advanced electronic signatures based on qualified certificates and of advanced electronic seals based on qualified certificates

CONTENTS.P:
The standards ETSI TS 119172-4 V1.1.1 (2021-05)
ETSI TS 119172-4 – Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); Signature Policies; Part 4: Signature applicability rules (validation policy) for European qualified electronic signatures/seals using trusted lists, V1.1.1 (2021-05). (ETSI TS 119172-4), and ETSI TS 119102-2 V1.4.1 (2023-06)
ETSI TS 119102-2 – Electronic Signatures and Infrastructures (ESI); Procedures for Creation and Validation of AdES Digital Signatures; Part 2: Signature Validation Report, V1.4.1 (2023-06). (ETSI TS 119102-2) apply with the following adaptations:

NP.TXT: 4.2 Validation constraints and validation procedures, requirement REQ-4.2-03, section X.509 validation constraints, point (c):

ITEM.P: (i) If an end-entity certificate represents a trust anchor, the RevocationCheckingConstraints shall not be used.

(ii) If an end-entity certificate does not represent a trust anchor, the RevocationCheckingConstraints shall be set to eitherCheck as defined in ETSI TS 119172-1 [3], clause A.4.2.1, table A.2 rows (m)2.1.
(iii) If an end-entity certificate represents a trust anchor, the RevocationFreshnessConstraints defined in ETSI TS 119172-1 [3], clause A.4.2.1, table A.2 rows (m)2.2 shall not be used.

(iv) If an end-entity certificate does not represent a trust anchor, the RevocationFreshnessConstraints defined in ETSI TS 119172-1 [3], clause A.4.2.1, table A.2 rows (m)2.2 shall be used with a maximum value of 24 hours for the signing certificate. No value shall be set for the RevocationFreshnessConstraints for certificates other than the signing certificate, including certificates supporting time-stamps.

NP.TXT: 4.3 Requirements on signature validation and applicability rules checking practices

ITEM.P: REQ-4.3-02 Signature validation applications shall be compliant with ETSI TS 119101 [13].
REQ-4.4.2-03 If any of the checks specified in REQ-4.4.2-01 fails, then:

NP.TXT: the signature shall be technically determined as indeterminate, i.e. as neither an advanced electronic signature based on EU qualified certificate, nor as an advanced electronic seal based on EU qualified certificate; and
the above result and the results of processes of all the intermediate processes shall be reflected in the signature applicability rules checking report.

ITEM.P: REQ-4.4.2-06 At that point of the TARC process, if the following conditions are met:

NP.TXT: the signing certificate is determined, at the best signature time, as an EU qualified certificate for electronic signatures (respectively for electronic seals), as specified in REQ-4.4.2-02 a); and
the result of the process performed as specified in clause 4.2 of the present document is TOTAL-PASSED,

ITEM.P: then the digital signature shall be determined as technically suitable to implement an EU advanced electronic signature based on a qualified certificate (respectively an EU advanced electronic seal based on a qualified certificate), otherwise the signature shall not be determined technically either as an EU advanced electronic signature based on a qualified certificate, or as an EU advanced electronic seal based on a qualified certificate.
